result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Motion Hearing ( 30 pages) commencing 10-20-2022 by Lisa Diamond.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Request to Appear Via Zoom 12/19/22

Defendant William J Scharmach in court.  Attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray in court for William J Scharmach.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court on Defense's motion to exclude evidence (unreasonable enlargement of detention).  Sworn for State: Justin Jackett (Greenfield Police Officer).  Closing arguments heard.  Court scheduled a decision hearing.  

State requests additional time to respond to Defense's motion to exclude evidence of prior conviction as penalty enhancer.  Court ordered State's response/reply filed by November 11, 2022 end of business day and Defense's response/reply filed by December 12, 2022 end of business day.

Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Decision scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William J Scharmach in court with attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a motion hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Exclude Evidence of Prior Conviction as Penalty Enhancer, filed
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Exclude Evidence Based Upon Unreasonable Enlargement of Detention, filed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William J Scharmach in court with attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William J Scharmach in court with attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Original Information previously filed. Defense prevoiusly received, and waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of  PRELIMINARY HEARING  (17 pages) commencing 03-21-2022  by *PAULINE GARRY.
Authorization to Appear, filed by defense

Defendant William J Scharmach in court with Attorney Matthew Mckenzie Murray; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 3 prior convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Greenfiled Officer J. Jackett.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 025924,
Payable Number: 992500,
Receipt Number: 22RP010507,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant William J Scharmach in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant William J Scharmach in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William J Scharmach appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
